facts: Nordau begins his work with a "medical" and social interpretation of Degeneration in society.
Nordau divides his study into five books.
In the first book, Nordau identifies the phenomenon of fin de siÃ¨cle in Europe.

Nordau describes the phenomenon of fin de siÃ¨cle as a contempt for traditional views of custom and morality.
Nordau sees the phenomenon of fin de siÃ¨cle as a sort of decadence and world-weariness.
Nordau sees the phenomenon of fin de siÃ¨cle as a wilful rejection of moral boundaries governing the world.
Nordau uses examples from French periodicals and books in French to show how the phenomenon has affected all elements of society.
Nordau accuses society of becoming more inclined to imitate what they see in art.
Nordau sees in the fashionable society of Paris and London that every single figure strives visibly by some singularity in outline, set, cut, or colour to startle attention violently.
Nordau sees that each figure wishes to create a strong nervous excitement, regardless of whether it is agreeable or disagreeable.
Nordau establishes the cultural phenomenon of fin de siÃ¨cle in the opening pages.
Nordau quickly moves to the viewpoint of a physician.
Nordau identifies what he sees as an illness.
The fin-de-siÃ¨cle disposition influences contemporary art and poetry.
The life and conduct of men who write mystic, symbolic, and 'decadent' works are notable.
The attitude taken by admirers reflects the tastes and aesthetic instincts of fashionable society.
There are two well-defined conditions of disease: degeneration and hysteria.
The minor stages of hysteria are designated as neurasthenia.
The physician is quite familiar with degeneration and hysteria.
The book deals with numerous case studies of various artists, writers, and thinkers.
The artists, writers, and thinkers include Oscar Wilde, Henrik Ibsen, Richard Wagner, and Friedrich Nietzsche.
The basic premise of the book is that society and human beings are degenerating.
The degeneration of society and human beings is reflected in art.
The degeneration of society and human beings is influenced by art.
Hannah Arendt refers to late 19th Century French society in her book The Origins of Totalitarianism.

The unusual or exotic types or individuals include criminals, Gypsies, and Turks.
Nordau's position is not novel or isolated as social criticism.
rules: The degeneration of society and human beings is both reflected in and influenced by art.

The women hope to avoid detection by local law-enforcement.

Ray needs just one more crossing to finance the down payment on her mobile home.

Ray's fast and erratic driving catches the attention of the provincial police.
Ray tries to elude capture by crossing a frozen river.

The four women abandon the vehicle.
The four women take refuge at the Indian reservation.
rules: Ray is shaken after being shot in the ear.
Ray's erratic driving leads to police attention.
The four women seek refuge after abandoning the vehicle.

facts: The police are demanding a scapegoat.

Lila is surprised by the news of her excommunication.

Colin Sullivan is a child introduced to organized crime by Frank Costello.

Colin Sullivan is accepted into the Special Investigations Unit.
The Special Investigations Unit focuses on organized crime.

facts: Billy Costigan is recruited by Captain Queenan.
Billy Costigan is recruited by Staff Sergeant Dignam.
Billy Costigan is going undercover.
Billy Costigan has family ties to organized crime.
Billy Costigan is a perfect infiltrator.
Billy Costigan drops out of the police academy.
Billy Costigan does time in prison on a fake assault charge.
Billy Costigan's fake assault charge increases his credibility.
rules: Billy Costigan is recruited to go undercover due to his family ties to organized crime.

facts: Each man infiltrates his respective organization.
Sullivan begins a romance with police psychiatrist Madolyn Madden.
Costigan is seeing Madolyn Madden under the terms of his probation.
Costigan and Madolyn Madden begin a relationship.
Costello escapes a sting operation.
Each mole becomes aware of the other's existence.

Costigan follows Costello into a porn theater.

Neither Costigan nor Sullivan knows the other's identity after the chase.
Sullivan has Queenan tailed to a meeting with Costigan on the roof of a building.

Costello's men throw Queenan off the building to his death.
Costigan pretends he has come to join Costello's men after exiting the building.
Television news reports that crew member Delahunt has been a Boston Police Department undercover cop.
Costello believes the report about Delahunt to be a lie designed to lull him into a sense of security.
Dignam resigns rather than work with Sullivan.
Dignam suspects Sullivan is the mole after being asked why he had Queenan followed.
rules: None.

facts: Queenan's phone is used by Sullivan to reach Costigan.
Costigan refuses to abort his mission.
Sullivan learns from Queenan's diary about Costello's role as an informant for the FBI.
Sullivan worries about his own identity being revealed.

Costello tries to shoot Sullivan.

Costello is dead.

Costigan comes to Sullivan for restoration of his true identity.

Sullivan erases Costigan's records from the police computer system.

Sullivan finds Madolyn listening to a CD from Costigan.
The CD contains incriminating recorded conversations between Costello and Sullivan.
Sullivan attempts to assuage Madolyn's suspicions unsuccessfully.

Trooper Barrigan shoots Costigan in the head.

Sullivan is identified by Sullivan as the mole.
Sullivan recommends Costigan for the Medal of Merit.

facts: Costigan's funeral takes place.
Sullivan notices that Madolyn is tearful at the funeral.
Sullivan attempts to talk to Madolyn as they leave the gravesite.
Madolyn ignores Sullivan when he attempts to talk to her.
Sullivan returns to his apartment after the funeral.
Sullivan is ambushed by Dignam as he enters his apartment.
Dignam shoots and kills Sullivan.
Rick Deckard is an ex-police officer.
Rick Deckard is detained by officer Gaff.
Rick Deckard is brought to his former supervisor, Bryant.
Rick Deckard's job as a "Blade Runner" was to track down bioengineered beings known as replicants.
Rick Deckard's job as a "Blade Runner" involved "retiring" replicants.
Four replicants have come to Earth illegally.
Replicants are bioengineered beings.
Tyrell Corporation Nexus-6 models have only a four-year lifespan.
Replicants may have come to Earth to try to extend their lives.
rules: Rick Deckard is informed about the illegal arrival of four replicants.

facts: Deckard watches a video of a Blade Runner named Holden.
Holden administers the "Voight-Kampff" test.
The "Voight-Kampff" test is designed to distinguish replicants from humans.
The test is based on the emotional response of the test subject to questions.
The test subject is Leon.

Bryant wants Deckard to retire Leon and three other replicants.
The three other replicants are Roy Batty, Zhora, and Pris.
Deckard initially refuses to retire Leon and the other replicants.
Bryant ambiguously threatens Deckard.
Deckard reluctantly agrees to retire Leon and the other replicants.
rules: Deckard must retire Leon and the other replicants after Bryant's threat.

facts: Deckard begins his investigation at the Tyrell Corporation.
Deckard ensures that the test works on Nexus-6 models.
Dr. Eldon Tyrell has an assistant named Rachael.
Rachael is an experimental replicant.
Rachael believes herself to be human.
Rachael has been given false memories.
The false memories provide Rachael with an "emotional cushion."
A more extensive test is required to determine whether Rachael is a replicant.
rules: Rachael is a replicant if a more extensive test is required to determine her nature.

facts: Deckard searches for the replicants.
The replicants search for Tyrell to force him to extend their lives.
Roy and Leon investigate a replicant eye-manufacturing laboratory.
Roy and Leon learn of J.F. Sebastian.
J.F. Sebastian is a gifted genetic designer.
J.F. Sebastian works closely with Tyrell.
Rachael visits Deckard at his apartment.
Rachael shows Deckard a family photo to prove her humanity.
Deckard reveals that Rachael's memories are implants from Tyrell's niece.
Rachael leaves Deckard's apartment in tears.
Pris locates Sebastian.
Pris manipulates Sebastian to gain his trust.
Deckard searches Leon's hotel room.
Deckard finds a photo of Zhora in Leon's hotel room.
Deckard finds a synthetic snake scale in Leon's hotel room.
The synthetic snake scale leads Deckard to a strip club.
Zhora works at the strip club.
Deckard kills Zhora.
Bryant tells Deckard to retire Rachael.
Rachael has disappeared from the Tyrell Corporation.
Deckard spots Rachael in a crowd.
Leon attacks Deckard.
Rachael kills Leon using Deckard's dropped pistol.
Deckard and Rachael return to Deckard's apartment.
Deckard and Rachael have an intimate discussion.
Deckard promises not to hunt Rachael.
Rachael abruptly tries to leave Deckard's apartment.
Deckard physically restrains Rachael.
Deckard forces Rachael to kiss him.
Roy arrives at Sebastian's apartment.

Sebastian is sympathetic to Roy and Pris's plight.
Sebastian reveals that he has "Methuselah Syndrome," a genetic premature aging disorder.
Sebastian's life will be cut short because of "Methuselah Syndrome."
Sebastian and Roy gain entrance into Tyrell's secure penthouse.
Roy demands more life from Tyrell, his maker.
Tyrell tells Roy that it is impossible to give him more life.

Roy kisses Tyrell.
Roy kills Tyrell.
Sebastian runs for the elevator.
Roy follows Sebastian to the elevator.
Roy rides the elevator down alone.

Roy's actions lead to the deaths of Tyrell and potentially Sebastian.

facts: Deckard enters Sebastian's apartment.
Deckard is ambushed by Pris.
Deckard kills Pris.
Roy returns as Deckard kills Pris.
Roy starts to die.
Roy chases Deckard through the building.
Deckard ends up on the roof.
Deckard tries to jump to an adjacent roof.
Deckard misses the jump.
Deckard is left hanging precariously between buildings.
Roy makes the jump with ease.
Roy hoists Deckard onto the roof.
Roy saves Deckard.
Roy's life runs out.
Roy delivers a monologue about his memories.
Roy's memories will be lost like tears in rain.
Roy dies in front of Deckard.
Deckard watches silently as Roy dies.
Gaff arrives.
Gaff shouts across to Deckard.
Gaff says, "It's too bad she won't live, but then again, who does?"
Deckard returns to his apartment.
Deckard finds the door ajar.
Rachael is safe and asleep in Deckard's bed.
Deckard notices a small tin-foil origami unicorn on the floor.
The origami unicorn is a familiar calling card.
The origami unicorn brings back Gaff's final words to Deckard.
Deckard and Rachael quickly leave the apartment block.
rules: Roy saves Deckard as Roy's life runs out.
Gaff's final words are linked to the origami unicorn found by Deckard.

facts: An elderly World War II veteran visits the Normandy American Cemetery and Memorial in Normandy, France.
The veteran is accompanied by his family.
The veteran walks around the cemetery.
The veteran sees one specific gravestone.
The veteran collapses to his knees.
The veteran is overwhelmed by emotion.
The film flashes back to the morning of June 6, 1944.
June 6, 1944, is the beginning of the Normandy Invasion.
American soldiers prepare to land on Omaha Beach.
American soldiers suffer heavily from their struggle against German infantry.
American soldiers struggle against machine gun nests.
American soldiers struggle against artillery fire.
Captain John H. Miller is a company commander of the 2nd Ranger Battalion.
Captain John H. Miller survives the initial landing.
Captain John H. Miller assembles a group of Rangers.
The group of Rangers penetrates the German defenses.
The group of Rangers leads to a breakout from the beach.
The body of a dead soldier is shown lying face down on the beach.
"S. Ryan" is inscribed on the back of the dead soldier's uniform.
rules: Captain John H. Miller leads a group of Rangers to penetrate German defenses during the Normandy Invasion.

facts: General George Marshall is at the U.S. War Department in Washington, D.C.
Three of the four brothers of the Ryan family were killed in action.
The mother of the Ryan family is to receive all three telegrams in the same day.
The fourth son of the Ryan family is Private First Class James Francis Ryan.
James Francis Ryan is a paratrooper.
James Francis Ryan is missing in action somewhere in Normandy.
General George Marshall reads Abraham Lincoln's Bixby letter.
General George Marshall orders that James Francis Ryan must be found and sent home immediately.
rules: If three brothers of the Ryan family are killed in action, then their mother receives all three telegrams in the same day.
If James Francis Ryan is a paratrooper and missing in action, then General George Marshall orders that James Francis Ryan must be found and sent home immediately.

facts: Miller receives orders to find Ryan and bring him back from the front three days after D-Day.
Miller assembles six men from his company.
The six men are T/Sgt. Mike Horvath, Private First Class Richard Reiben, Privates Stanley Mellish, Adrian Caparzo, Danny Jackson, and medic Irwin Wade.
T/5 Timothy Upham is a cartographer who speaks French and German.
Timothy Upham is loaned from the 29th Infantry Division.
Miller and his men move out to Neuville.
Miller and his men meet a squad from the 101st Airborne Division.
Caparzo dies after being shot by a sniper.
A Private James Ryan is located but is not the correct man.
A member of Ryan's regiment informs that Ryan's drop zone was at Vierville.
Ryan's company and another company had the same rally point.
Miller meets a friend of Ryan's at the rally point.
Ryan is defending a strategically important bridge over the Merderet River in the fictional town of Ramelle.
Miller decides to neutralize a German machine gun position on the way to Ramelle.
Wade is fatally wounded in the skirmish.
Miller declines to execute a surviving German nicknamed "Steamboat Willie."
Miller sets "Steamboat Willie" free on the condition that he give himself up as a prisoner of war to the first Allied unit he encounters.
Reiben declares his intention to desert the squad and the mission.
Reiben's declaration prompts a confrontation with Horvath.
The argument heats up until Miller discloses his background in civilian life.
The squad had earlier set up a betting pool about Miller's background.
Reiben reluctantly decides to stay after Miller's disclosure.
rules: Miller's leadership is questioned by Reiben after the confrontation.

facts: Miller and the squad arrive at Ramelle.
Miller and the squad come upon a small group of paratroopers.
One of the paratroopers is Ryan.
Ryan is told of his brothers' deaths.
Ryan is informed of the mission to bring him home.
Two men had been lost in the quest to find Ryan.
Ryan is distressed at the loss of his brothers.
Ryan does not consider it fair to go home.
Ryan asks Miller to tell his mother that he intends to stay with the only brothers he has left.
Miller decides to take command.
Miller decides to defend the bridge with what little manpower and resources are available.
Miller forms ambush positions throughout the ruined town.
Miller uses his own men and the accompanying paratroopers.
Miller utilizes Molotov cocktails, detonation cords, and "sticky bombs" made from socks and TNT for the ambush.
rules: Miller takes command to defend the bridge.

facts: Elements of the 2nd SS Panzer Division arrive with infantry and armor.
The 2nd SS Panzer Division inflicts heavy casualties on the Germans.
Most of the paratroopers are killed.
Jackson is killed.
Mellish is killed.
Horvath is killed.
Miller attempts to blow the bridge.
Miller is shot and mortally wounded by a German soldier.
A Tiger tank reaches the bridge.
An American P-51 Mustang flies overhead and destroys the Tiger tank.
American armored units rout the remaining Germans.
Upham surprises a group of German soldiers as they attempt to retreat.
The German infantryman who shot Miller is named "Steamboat Willie."
"Steamboat Willie" raises his hands in surrender.
Upham witnesses Captain Miller being shot by "Steamboat Willie."
Upham shoots "Steamboat Willie."
Upham lets the other surviving Germans flee.
rules: Upham accepts the surrender of a German soldier based on their earlier encounter.

facts: Reiben and Ryan are with Miller as he dies.
Miller says his last words, "James ... earn this. Earn it."
The film returns to the present.
The veteran is Ryan.
The grave Ryan is standing at is Miller's.
Ryan asks his wife to confirm that he has led a good life.
Ryan asks his wife if he is a "good man."
Ryan's wife replies, "You are."
Ryan stands at attention.
Ryan delivers a salute toward Miller's grave.
rules: Ryan is worthy of the sacrifice of Miller and the others.

facts: Bertha Young and Harry host a dinner party.
Bertha Young is depicted as a happy soul.
Bertha Young is naive about the world and those closest to her.
The dinner party raises questions about deceit, self-awareness, and the possibility of homosexuality at the start of the 20th century.
The dinner party is attended by Mr. and Mrs. Norman Knight, who are close friends of Bertha and Harry.
Eddie Warren is an effeminate character at the dinner party.
Pearl Fulton is a guest at the dinner party.
Bertha is mysteriously drawn to Pearl for unknown reasons.
Harry is perceived by Bertha as a crude and disinterested person.
Harry has a strong dislike for Pearl, as shown by his conversational tone and curtness.
Bertha questions her interest and fascination towards Pearl during the dinner party.
Eddie is most likely homosexual.
Bertha realizes that her connection with Pearl is due to their mutual attraction for Harry.
Bertha discovers that Harry and Pearl are having an affair.
The title of the story suggests that ignorance is bliss.
The story questions whether it is better to live blissfully ignorant of the truth or to live with the knowledge of a harsh reality.
rules: Bertha's interest in Pearl may be more than platonic due to the presence of Eddie and the mutual attraction for Harry.

facts: The story revolves around a struggle to determine which of Satan's three sons will succeed Satan as ruler of Hell.
Adrian is the most intelligent son of Satan.
Cassius is the toughest son of Satan.
Nicky is Satan's favorite son.
Nicky has a speech impediment.
Nicky has a disfigured jaw.
Cassius hit Nicky in the face with a shovel.
Adrian and Cassius enjoy tormenting Nicky.
Adrian and Cassius claim that Nicky's mother was a goat.
Adrian and Cassius assault Nicky by controlling his body with their minds.
rules: Adrian and Cassius torment Nicky because Nicky is their father's favorite son.

facts: Satan has been the "prince of darkness" for ten thousand years.
Satan assembles his sons to decide which of them will succeed him.
Satan keeps the throne for himself.
Satan's sons are not yet ready to be his successor.
Satan tells his sons that they need to learn to keep the balance between good and evil.
Adrian and Cassius are angered by Satan's decision.
Adrian and Cassius go to Earth to create a new Hell.
Adrian and Cassius possess religious and political leaders in New York City.
Adrian and Cassius freeze the entrance to Hell.
Freezing the entrance to Hell prevents more souls from entering.
Satan's body begins decomposing.
Satan's body literally falls apart.
Satan sends Nicky to Earth.
Nicky is sent with a silver flask.
The silver flask traps whoever drinks from it inside.
rules: Adrian and Cassius create a new Hell by possessing religious and political leaders in New York City.

facts: Nicky has trouble staying alive on Earth.
Nicky is killed several times.
Nicky lands in Hell and returns to New York each time he is killed.
Nicky learns how to eat and sleep.
Nicky meets a talking bulldog named Mr. Beefy.
Mr. Beefy is a friend of Nicky's father.
Nicky rents an apartment with an actor named Todd.
Nicky falls in love with a design student named Valerie.
rules: Nicky experiences multiple deaths and returns to New York from Hell.

facts: Nicky's first encounter with his brothers occurs when Adrian sees Nicky with Valerie.
Adrian takes mental control of Nicky's body.
Nicky scares Valerie away.
Nicky sees Cassius on television.
Cassius possesses the referee of a Harlem Globetrotters game.
The referee's name is Dana Carvey.
Nicky goes to the court.
Nicky tricks Cassius into the flask.
Metalheads John and Peter are thrilled with Nicky's performance.
John and Peter become devoted fans of Nicky.
Nicky tries to apologize to Valerie that evening.
The meeting between Nicky and Valerie goes badly at first.
Valerie accepts Nicky after he explains who he is.
Nicky explains to Valerie why he is on Earth.
rules: Nicky's performance impresses John and Peter, leading them to become his devoted fans.

facts: Adrian possesses the chief of the NYPD, who is Michael McKean.
Adrian accuses Nicky of mass murder using a badly edited scene from Scarface.
Nicky has Todd kill him so he can go back to Hell.
Nicky wants to ask his father for advice.
Nicky's father has trouble hearing because his ears have fallen off.
Nicky's father's assistants are in a panic.
The midnight deadline to capture Adrian and Cassius is only hours away.
Nicky and his friends devise a plan to capture Adrian in a subway station.
John and Peter inform the chief of the NYPD of Nicky's whereabouts.
Todd and Mr. Beefy are arrested.
Adrian discovers Nicky's trick when he realizes that John is keeping cool whereas Peter isn't.
Adrian realizes that John is being possessed by Nicky.
In the ensuing fight, Adrian grabs Valerie and dives onto the track as a train approaches.
Nicky throws Valerie out of the way.
Nicky and Adrian are killed by the train.
rules: Nicky's actions lead to the death of both Nicky and Adrian.

facts: Adrian arrives in Hell just minutes before midnight.
Adrian dethrones his weakened father.
Adrian takes over and rises into Central Park.
Adrian starts a riotous party in Central Park.
All of the demons except Satan's assistant Jimmy join Adrian on Earth.
Nicky wakes up in Heaven as a reward for sacrificing himself.
Nicky meets his mother Holly, who is an angel.
Holly tells Nicky he can defeat Adrian with the "inner light" he inherited from her.
Holly gives Nicky a mysterious orb.
Nicky goes to Central Park.
The demons discover Nicky and try to attack him.
Nicky creates gifts for the demons.
The gifts make the demons respect Nicky enough to join him.
The demons stop Adrian.
The demons run away when Adrian kills one of them.
Nicky and Adrian fight.
Nicky and Adrian are sucked into the flask.
Nicky and Adrian have a three-way battle with Cassius.
Adrian appears to win a pitched battle by locking Nicky in the flask.
Adrian turns himself into a bat.
Nicky escapes from the flask with Valerie's help.
Nicky shatters the orb.
Ozzy Osbourne appears after Nicky shatters the orb.
Ozzy Osbourne bites Adrian's head off and spits it into the flask.
The scene where Ozzy bites the head off a bat was inspired by an actual incident.
rules: Nicky can defeat Adrian with the "inner light" inherited from Holly.
The demons respect Nicky enough to join him after he creates gifts for them.
Adrian can turn himself into a bat.
Ozzy Osbourne can bite Adrian's head off.

facts: Nicky's brothers are captured.
Nicky is ready to save his father.
Nicky sins to ensure he goes to Hell by setting bees on Henry Winkler.
Nicky and Valerie express their love for each other.
Valerie kills Nicky with a boulder given to her by Ozzy.
The flow of souls is restored in Hell.
Satan regains his body.
Satan recommends that Nicky go back to live on Earth.
Adrian and Cassius are still inside a flask.
Adrian and Cassius are shoved up Adolf Hitler's rectum.
A year later, Nicky and Valerie live in New York with their infant son, Zachariah.
John and Peter have died in a plane crash.
John and Peter are now happily living in Hell in Nicky's old bedroom.
rules: Nicky goes back to live on Earth after being recommended by Satan.
Valerie kills Nicky after they express their love for each other.
